page.title: 03TOURISM / KENTON HOTEL
page.content:
Tourism :People found the shops quite expensive but they liked being able to hire things like windbreaks and deck chairs.
We visited 3 hotels on Wednesday, 3rd July, 1985. The Kenton hotel,Whipsiderry Porth is owned by 85 year old Mr Yelland who built the hotel himself. Mr Yelland has lived in Porth for 49 years and thinks that the area has deteriorated terribly. The Kenton is a friendly hotel with 22 bedrooms and no amusements.The hotel costs Â£73.05 a week bed and breakfast and evening meal in August.
